Testifying at today's hearing, Wesley Wannemacher said he learned the hard way how a relatively small charge on his credit card could quickly get out of control.
In 2001, Wannemacher ran up $3,200 on his credit to pay for his wedding, including a photographer and flowers.
He says he agreed to come to Washington to testify so others wouldn't have to go through what he did.
I'm only here to let people know what happened to me.
